name: vscode-thunder-client
description: Lightweight Rest API Client for VS Code

keybindings.when: activeWebviewPanelId == tc.request-view || activeWebviewPanelId == tc.env-view || activeWebviewPanelId == tc.runcol-view

thunder-client.httpLibrary.markdownDescription: The http library to use to send API requests.

thunder-client.saveToWorkspace.markdownDescription: [[Subscription required](https://www.thunderclient.com/pricing)] Requests data will be saved and loaded automatically from current workspace folder, `Suitable for Teams with multiple projects`. The tests folder `thunder-tests` will be created at the root. for more details [visit here](https://docs.thunderclient.com/team)

thunder-client.workspaceRelativePath.markdownDescription: [[Subscription required](https://www.thunderclient.com/pricing)] Relative path to the current workspace folder, where you like to save tests data, `Save To Workspace` setting needs to be enabled first. The tests folder `thunder-tests` will be created here. for more details [visit here](https://docs.thunderclient.com/team)

thunder-client.multiRootWorkspaceName.markdownDescription: [[Subscription required](https://www.thunderclient.com/pricing)] Mutile root workspace name to use to save requests data. This value is automatically set by the extension when you open `project.code-workspace` file.

thunder-client.customLocation.markdownDescription: [[Subscription required](https://www.thunderclient.com/pricing)] Enter full folder path to store requests data, `Suitable for storing all requests data in one fixed location`. Also supports home folder `$HOME/path`. for more details [visit here](https://docs.thunderclient.com/team)

thunder-client.customMethods.markdownDescription: Please enter Http Methods separated by comma e.g: `search,subscribe`. Close and Re-open Review View to see changes.

thunder-client.editorFontSize.markdownDescription:
Thunder Client editor font size 
 - Use 0 to use default font size.
 - Use any other value to set custom font size.

thunder-client.editorVariableHighlight.markdownDescription: Thunder Client Request Body Editor environment variables highlight.

thunder-client.indentSize.markdownDescription: Thunder Client UI Editors JSON format indentation, select 2 or 4 spaces, default is `2 spaces`

thunder-client.jsonFileIndentSize.markdownDescription: Indent Size for JSON files generated by Thunder Client, default is `4 spaces`

thunder-client.requestLayout.markdownDescription: Select the request view layout for `request/response` sections. Please `close` request tab and `re-open` to apply new layout

thunder-client.excludeProxyHostList.markdownDescription: Comma separated Host names to exclude from proxy e.g: `abc.com,xyz.com`

thunder-client.defaultURL.markdownDescription: Please provide Default URL of the Request

thunder-client.httpVersion.markdownDescription: Http Version for making the request, default is HTTP/1.1

thunder-client.responseLimit.markdownDescription: Response Display Limit in MB, Default is 2MB

thunder-client.htmlReportResponseLimit.markdownDescription: The HTML Report Response Display Limit is in KB. The default is `100KB`. If set to `0KB`, the response will not be included in the report. If set to `-1`, responses will only be saved for `failed` requests.

thunder-client.saveRequestOnSend.markdownDescription: `Save Request` when Send button is clicked in Collections. If disabled, the request will be sent without saving. Use shortcut `ctrl/cmd + s` to save the request explicitly

thunder-client.contentType.markdownDescription: Automatically send `Content-Type` header when body is sent in request, If disabled, the `Content-Type` header will not be sent

thunder-client.previewFeatures.markdownDescription: Preview features can be tested by enabling this option.

thunder-client.restoreTabs.markdownDescription: Restore last opened tabs on vscode reload (only applies to request views).

thunder-client.autoRunCurl.markdownDescription: Auto Run `cURL` request after import. If disabled, the `cURL` request will not be executed after import

thunder-client.saveTokenPerEnvironment.markdownDescription: Save OAuth 2 token based on environment, So this will allow to save `different access tokens` for `dev & prod` environments

thunder-client.sidebar.defaultTab.markdownDescription: Sidebar default active tab, default is `Activity`

thunder-client.sidebar.showActivityFromC.markdownDescription: Show Requests executed from collection in `Activity Tab`

thunder-client.sidebar.layout.markdownDescription: The default sidebar layout is `standard`. The `compact` layout will hide the request date section in `sidebar`

thunder-client.activeEnvironmentSelectio.markdownDescription: The default option for Active Environment selection is `Save To File`. The `Save To Local Memory` option will save the changes to the `Active Environment` in local memory

thunder-client.sidebar.treeIndentation.markdownDescription: Sidebar Collections tree indentation, `select 0` for default padding, `select 5 or 10` to add extra 5px or 10px padding

thunder-client.requestTimeout.markdownDescription: Request Timeout in milliseconds, 0 means no timeout

thunder-client.defaultHeaders.markdownDescription: Provide values for Default Headers for the Request

thunder-client.testValueColumnWidth.markdownDescription: Please provide `Test Value` column width in `percentage`, The value should be between `10 to 50`. The default value is `30`

thunder-client.certificates.markdownDescription: List of ssl certificates for hosts

certPath.description: the path of certificate file e.g: ssl/client_cert.pem

pfxPath.description: the path of PFX or PKCS12 encoded private key

passphrase.description: the passphrase to decrypt the client key

scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
